poem:
Title: "Absent Souls"

In the alleys of poverty, frail flowers vie,
Surviving; absent from knowledge's feast.
Health, a scarce leaven, that their edge denies.
Pandemic's shadow, on their youth, a beast. 
Chronic absence, the cruel inheritance,
of destitution's bitter feast.
Their silenced voices sing an echoing dance,
of futures lost, while society feasts.
